name: doi
description: DOI for the work registered with Crossref.

name: crossref
description: Crossref data is sourced from https://www.crossref.org/.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Work titles, including translated titles.

fields.name: abstract
fields.description: Abstract as a JSON string or a JATS XML snippet encoded into a JSON string.

fields.name: published_year
fields.description: Published year in YYYY.

fields.name: published_month
fields.description: Published month MM.

fields.name: published_year_month
fields.description: Published year and month YYYY-MM.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Enumeration, one of the type ids from https://api.crossref.org/v1/types.

fields.name: ISSN
fields.description: The ISSN of the work.

fields.name: ISBN
fields.description: The ISBN of the work.

fields.name: issn_type
fields.description: List of ISSNs with ISSN type information.

fields.name: type
fields.description: ISSN type, can either be print ISSN or electronic ISSN.

fields.name: value
fields.description: ISSN value.

fields.name: publisher_location
fields.description: Location of work's publisher.

fields.name: publisher
fields.description: Name of work's publisher.

fields.name: member
fields.description: Member identifier id, see id (https://api.crossref.org/members/).

fields.name: prefix
fields.description: DOI prefix identifier, see prefixes (https://api.crossref.org/members/).

fields.name: container_title
fields.description: Full titles of the containing work (usually a book or journal).

fields.name: short_container_title
fields.description: Abbreviated titles of the containing work.

fields.name: group_title
fields.description: Group title for posted content.

fields.name: references_count
fields.description: Count of outbound references deposited with Crossref.

fields.name: is_referenced_by_count
fields.description: Count of inbound references deposited with Crossref.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Subject category names, a controlled vocabulary from Sci-Val. Available for most journal articles.

fields.name: published_print
fields.description: Date on which content was published in print.

fields.name: date_parts
fields.description: Contains an ordered array of year, month, day of month. Only year is required. Note that the field contains a nested array, e.g. [ [ 2006, 5, 19 ] ] to conform to citeproc JSON dates.

fields.name: URL
fields.description: Link to a web page describing this license.

fields.name: content_version
fields.description: Either vor (version of record), am (accepted manuscript,) tdm (text and data mining) or unspecified.

fields.name: delay_in_days
fields.description: Number of days between the publication date of the work and the start date of this license.

fields.name: start
fields.description: Date on which this license begins to take effect.

fields.name: date_parts
fields.description: Contains an ordered array of year, month, day of month. Only year is required. Note that the field contains a nested array, e.g. [ [ 2006, 5, 19 ] ] to conform to citeproc JSON dates.

fields.name: date_time
fields.description: ISO 8601 date time.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Seconds since UNIX epoch.

fields.name: volume
fields.description: Volume number of an article's journal.

fields.name: funder
fields.description: Funder related data from https://www.crossref.org/services/funder-registry/

fields.name: DOI
fields.description: Optional Open Funder Registry DOI uniquely identifing the funding body (https://gitlab.com/crossref/open_funder_registry).

fields.name: award
fields.description: Award number(s) for awards given by the funding body.

fields.name: doi_asserted_by
fields.description: Either crossref or publisher.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Funding body primary name.

fields.name: page
fields.description: Pages numbers of an article within its journal.

fields.name: ORCID
fields.description: The ORCID ID for an author (in URL-form).

fields.name: affiliation
fields.description: Information about the author's institution or organization.

fields.name: acronym
fields.description: The acronym of the author's institution.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The full name of the author's institution.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Identifier for the author's institution or organization (ROR, ISNI, Wikidata).

fields.name: place
fields.description: The primary city location of the author's institution.

fields.name: department
fields.description: The department within the author's institution.

fields.name: authenticated_orcid
fields.description: If true, record owner asserts that the ORCID user completed ORCID OAuth authentication.

fields.name: family
fields.description: The family name of the author.

fields.name: given
fields.description: The given name of the author.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the author.

fields.name: sequence
fields.description: Sequence in the author list, first or additional.

fields.name: suffix
fields.description: The suffix of the author name, e.g. junior, senior, III.

fields.name: link
fields.description: URLs to full-text locations.

fields.name: URL
fields.description: Direct link to a full-text download location.

fields.name: content_type
fields.description: Content type (or MIME type) of the full-text object.

fields.name: content_version
fields.description: Either vor (version of record), am (accepted manuscript) or tdm.

fields.name: intended_application
fields.description: Either text-mining, similarity-checking, syndication or unspecified.

fields.name: clinical_trial_number
fields.description: Identifier of the clinical trial.

fields.name: registry
fields.description: DOI of the clinical trial registry that assigned the trial number.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Used to identify the article publication date in relation to the issuance of the trial results. One of preResults, results or postResults.

fields.name: alternative_id
fields.description: Other identifiers for the work provided by the depositing member.

name: openalex
description: OpenAlex data is sourced from https://openalex.org/

fields.name: doi
fields.description: The DOI for the work. Occasionally, a work has more than one DOI--for example, there might be one DOI for a preprint version hosted on bioRxiv, and another DOI for the published version. However, this field always has just one DOI, the DOI for the published work. If you want DOIs for other versions, you can find them in the Work.alternate_host_venues list.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The OpenAlex ID for this work.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of this work.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: Exactly the same as Work.title. It's useful for Works to include a display_name property, since all the other entities have one.

fields.name: publication_year
fields.description: The year this work was published.

fields.name: publication_date
fields.description:
The day when this work was published, formatted as an ISO 8601 date.
Where different publication dates exist, we select the earliest available date of electronic publication. 
This date applies to the version found at Work.url. The other versions, found in Work.alternate_host_venues, may have been published at different (earlier) dates.

fields.name: ids
fields.description: All the persistent identifiers (PIDs) that we know about for this work, as key: value pairs, where key is the PID namespace, and value is the PID. IDs are expressed as URIs where possible.

fields.name: openalex
fields.description: The OpenAlex ID, which is also found at Work.id

fields.name: doi
fields.description: The DOI. This is most likely, but not necessarily, a Crossref DOI

fields.name: mag
fields.description: The Microsoft Academic Graph ID

fields.name: pmid
fields.description: The Pubmed Identifier

fields.name: host_venue
fields.description: A HostVenue object describing how and where this work is being hosted online.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The OpenAlex ID for this venue.

fields.name: issn_l
fields.description: The ISSN-L identifying this venue. ISSN is a global and unique ID for serial publications. However, different media versions of a given publication (e.g., print and electronic) often have different ISSNs. This is why we can't have nice things. The ISSN-L or Linking ISSN solves the problem by designating a single canonical ISSN for all media versions of the title. It's usually the same as the print ISSN.

fields.name: issn
fields.description: The ISSNs used by this venue. Many publications have multiple ISSNs (see above), so ISSN-L should be used when possible.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: The name of the venue.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The name of this venue's publisher. Publisher is a tricky category, as journals often change publishers, publishers merge, publishers have subsidiaries ("imprints"), and of course no one is consistent in their naming. In the future, we plan to roll out support for a more structured publisher field, but for now it's just a string.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL where you can access this work.

fields.name: is_oa
fields.description: Set to true if the work hosted here can be read for free, without registration.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version of the work, based on the DRIVER Guidelines versioning scheme. Possible values are: -publishedVersion: The document’s version of record. This is the most authoritative version. -acceptedVersion: The document after having completed peer review and being officially accepted for publication. It will lack publisher formatting, but the content should be interchangeable with the that of the publishedVersion. -submittedVersion: the document as submitted to the publisher by the authors, but before peer-review. Its content may differ significantly from that of the accepted article.

fields.name: license
fields.description: The license applied to this work at this host. Most toll-access works don't have an explicit license (they're under "all rights reserved" copyright), so this field generally has content only if is_oa is true.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type or genre of the work. This field uses Crossref's "type" controlled vocabulary; you can see all possible values via the Crossref api here: https://api.crossref.org/types. Where possible, we just pass along Crossref's type value for each work. When that's impossible (eg the work isn't in Crossref), we do our best to figure out the type ourselves. Unfortunately the accuracy of Crossref's data for this isn't great, and ours isn't much better. We're working to develop better type classification.

fields.name: open_access
fields.description: Information about the access status of this work, as an OpenAccess object.

fields.name: is_oa
fields.description: True if this work is Open Access (OA). There are many ways to define OA. OpenAlex uses a broad definition: having a URL where you can read the fulltext of this work without needing to pay money or log in. You can use the alternate_host_venues and oa_status fields to narrow your results further, accommodating any definition of OA you like.

fields.name: oa_status
fields.description: The Open Access (OA) status of this work. Possible values are: -gold: Published in an OA journal that is indexed by the DOAJ. -green: Toll-access on the publisher landing page, but there is a free copy in an OA repository. -hybrid: Free under an open license in a toll-access journal. -bronze: Free to read on the publisher landing page, but without any identifiable license. -closed: All other articles.

fields.name: oa_url
fields.description: The best Open Access (OA) URL for this work. Although there are many ways to define OA, in this context an OA URL is one where you can read the fulltext of this work without needing to pay money or log in. The "best" such URL is the one closest to the version of record. This URL might be a direct link to a PDF, or it might be to a landing page that links to the free PDF

fields.name: authorships
fields.description: List of Authorship objects, each representing an author and their institution.

fields.name: author_position
fields.description: A summarized description of this author's position in the work's author list. Possible values are first, middle, and last. It's not strictly necessary, because author order is already implicitly recorded by the list order of Authorship objects; however it's useful in some contexts to have this as a categorical value.

fields.name: author
fields.description: An author of this work, as a dehydrated Author object.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The OpenAlex ID for this author.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: The name of the author as a single string.

fields.name: orcid
fields.description: The ORCID for this author. ORCID global and unique ID for authors.

fields.name: institutions
fields.description: The institutional affiliations this author claimed in the context of this work, as dehydrated Institution objects.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The OpenAlex ID for this institution.

fields.name: ror
fields.description: The ROR ID for this institution. The ROR (Research Organization Registry) identifier is a globally unique ID for research organization. ROR is the successor to GRiD, which is no longer being updated.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: The primary name of the institution.

fields.name: country_code
fields.description: The country where this institution is located, represented as an ISO two-letter country code.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The institution's primary type, using the ROR "type" controlled vocabulary. Possible values are: Education, Healthcare, Company, Archive, Nonprofit, Government, Facility, and Other.

fields.name: cited_by_count
fields.description: The number of citations to this work. These are the times that other works have cited this work: Other works ➞ This work.

fields.name: biblio
fields.description: Old-timey bibliographic info for this work. This is mostly useful only in citation/reference contexts. These are all strings because sometimes you'll get fun values like "Spring" and "Inside cover."

fields.name: is_retracted
fields.description: True if we know this work has been retracted. This field has high precision but low recall. In other words, if is_retracted is  true, the article is definitely retracted. But if is_retracted is False,  it still might be retracted, but we just don't know. This is because unfortunately, the open sources for retraction data aren't currently very comprehensive, and the more comprehensive ones aren't sufficiently open for us to use here.

fields.name: is_paratext
fields.description:
True if we think this work is paratext. In our context, paratext is stuff that's in scholarly venue (like a journal) but is about the venue rather than a scholarly work properly speaking.  Some examples and nonexamples: -yep it's paratext: front cover, back cover, table of contents, editorial board listing, issue information,  masthead. -no,  not paratext: research paper, dataset, letters to the editor, figures. Turns out there is a lot of paratext in registries like Crossref. That's not a bad thing... but we've found that it's good to have a way to filter it out.
We determine is_paratext algorithmically using title heuristics.

fields.name: concepts
fields.description:
List of dehydrated Concept objects. 
Each Concept object in the list also has one additional property

fields.name: id
fields.description: The OpenAlex ID for this concept.

fields.name: wikidata
fields.description: The Wikidata ID for this concept.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: The English-language label of the concept.

fields.name: level
fields.description: The level in the concept tree where this concept lives.

fields.name: score
fields.description: The strength of the connection between the work and this concept (higher is stronger).

fields.name: mesh
fields.description: List of MeSH tag objects. Only works found in PubMed have MeSH tags; for all other works, this is an empty list.

fields.name: alternate_host_venues
fields.description: List of HostVenue objects describing places this work lives. This work's primary hosting venue isn't in this list; it's at host_venue. Some venues in this list are missing the id field! This should be fixed by February 2022.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The OpenAlex ID for this venue.

fields.name: issn_l
fields.description: The ISSN-L identifying this venue. ISSN is a global and unique ID for serial publications. However, different media versions of a given publication (e.g., print and electronic) often have different ISSNs. This is why we can't have nice things. The ISSN-L or Linking ISSN solves the problem by designating a single canonical ISSN for all media versions of the title. It's usually the same as the print ISSN.

fields.name: issn
fields.description: The ISSNs used by this venue. Many publications have multiple ISSNs (see above), so ISSN-L should be used when possible.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: The name of the venue.

fields.name: publisher
fields.description: The name of this venue's publisher. Publisher is a tricky category, as journals often change publishers, publishers merge, publishers have subsidiaries ("imprints"), and of course no one is consistent in their naming. In the future, we plan to roll out support for a more structured publisher field, but for now it's just a string.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL where you can access this work.

fields.name: is_oa
fields.description: Set to true if the work hosted here can be read for free, without registration.

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version of the work, based on the DRIVER Guidelines versioning scheme. Possible values are: -publishedVersion: The document’s version of record. This is the most authoritative version. -acceptedVersion: The document after having completed peer review and being officially accepted for publication. It will lack publisher formatting, but the content should be interchangeable with the that of the publishedVersion. -submittedVersion: the document as submitted to the publisher by the authors, but before peer-review. Its content may differ significantly from that of the accepted article.

fields.name: license
fields.description: The license applied to this work at this host. Most toll-access works don't have an explicit license (they're under "all rights reserved" copyright), so this field generally has content only if is_oa is true.

fields.name: referenced_works
fields.description: OpenAlex IDs for works that this work cites. These are citations that go from this work out to another work: This work ➞ Other works.

fields.name: abstract_inverted_index
fields.description: The abstract of the work, as an inverted index, which encodes information about the abstract's words and their positions within the text. Like Microsoft Academic Graph, OpenAlex doesn't include plaintext abstracts due to legal constraints.

fields.name: keys
fields.description: Custom field created by COKI. Originally each word in the abstract was a key and the indices of where this word occurred inside the abstract the corresponding value.

fields.name: values
fields.description: Custom field created by COKI. Originally each word in the abstract was a key and the indices of where this word occurred inside the abstract the corresponding value.

fields.name: cited_by_api_url
fields.description: OpenAlex IDs for works related to this work.

fields.name: updated_date
fields.description: The last time anything in this Work object changed, expressed as an ISO 8601 date string. This date is updated for any change at all, including increases in various counts.

name: mag
description: Data sourced from Microsoft Academic Graph https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/research/project/microsoft-academic-graph/

fields.name: PaperId
fields.description: PRIMARY KEY in mag

fields.name: Rank
fields.description: The static rank roughly reflects the log probability of an entity being 'important' - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/academic-services/graph/resources-faq#what-is-the-rank-value-on-entities

fields.name: Doi
fields.description: Doi values are upper-cased per DOI standard

fields.name: DocType
fields.description: Book, BookChapter, Conference, Dataset, Journal, Patent, Repository, Thesis, NULL : unknown

fields.name: PaperTitle
fields.description: The title of the Paper

fields.name: OriginalTitle
fields.description: The Original Title of the Paper

fields.name: BookTitle
fields.description: The Book Title (optional)

fields.name: Year
fields.description: The year of publication

fields.name: Date
fields.description: The date of publication

fields.name: Publisher
fields.description: The name of the publisher

fields.name: Volume
fields.description: The volume (optional)

fields.name: Issue
fields.description: The Issue (optional)

fields.name: FirstPage
fields.description: The First Page (optional)

fields.name: LastPage
fields.description: The Last page (optional)

fields.name: ReferenceCount
fields.description: The number of Papers this Paper references

fields.name: CitationCount
fields.description: The number of Papers that cite this Paper

fields.name: EstimatedCitation
fields.description: An estimation of objects citing this paper beyond what MAG has in it's database

fields.name: OriginalVenue
fields.description: The original venue of publication

fields.name: FamilyId
fields.description: A paper 'family' is defined as a group of papers that have been determined to be the same fundamental paper, but published in different venues - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/academic-services/graph/resources-faq#what-is-familyid-in-papers

fields.name: DocSubTypes
fields.description: "Retracted Publication", "Retraction Notice"

fields.name: abstract
fields.description: Paper Abstract (this has been normalised but see - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/academic-services/graph/resources-faq#what-format-are-paper-abstracts-published-in)

fields.name: level_0
fields.description: Links fields of study at level 0

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description: The displayed name of the Field of Study

fields.name: FieldOfStudyId
fields.description: PRIMARY KEY

fields.name: Rank
fields.description: The static rank roughly reflects the log probability of an entity being 'important' - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/academic-services/graph/resources-faq#what-is-the-rank-value-on-entities

fields.name: MainType
fields.description: Optional: The type or category of entity this field of study belongs within

fields.name: Score
fields.description: Confidence range between 0 and 1. Bigger number representing higher confidence

fields.description: Links fields of study at level 1

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description: The displayed name of the Field of Study

fields.name: level_2

fields.name: DisplayName

fields.description: The static rank roughly reflects the log probability of an entity being 'important' - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/academic-services/graph/resources-faq#what-is-the-rank-value-on-entities

fields.name: MainType

fields.name: FieldOfStudyId

fields.name: Rank
fields.description: The static rank roughly reflects the log probability of an entity being 'important' - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/academic-services/graph/resources-faq#what-is-the-rank-value-on-entities

fields.description: PRIMARY KEY

fields.name: Rank
fields.description: The static rank roughly reflects the log probability of an entity being 'important' - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/academic-services/graph/resources-faq#what-is-the-rank-value-on-entities

fields.name: MainType

fields.name: Rank

fields.name: MainType

fields.name: Score
fields.description: Confidence range between 0 and 1. Bigger number representing higher confidence

fields.name: DescriptorUI
fields.description: Descriptor Unique Identifier. Seven-character alpha-numeric string - https://www.nlm.nih.gov/mesh/mbinfo.html

fields.name: DescriptorName
fields.description: A term that uniquely refers to its <DescriptorRecord>

fields.name: QualifierUI
fields.description: Qualifier Unique Identifier. Seven-character alpha-numeric string uniquely identifying a <QualifierRecord>

fields.name: QualifierName
fields.description: Term that uniquely names its <QualifierRecord>

fields.name: AuthorSequenceNumber
fields.description: 1-based author sequence number. 1: the 1st author listed on paper, 2: the 2nd author listed on paper, etc.

fields.name: AuthorID
fields.description: PRIMARY KEY: Unique Identifier for an Author

fields.name: OriginalAuthor
fields.description: Original Author Name

fields.name: AffiliationId
fields.description: PRIMARY KEY: Unique Identifier for an Organisation

fields.name: OriginalAffiliation
fields.description: Original Author Affiliation String

fields.name: GridId
fields.description: The Grid ID of the Organisation

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description: The Displayed name of the Author

fields.name: JournalId
fields.description: PRIMARY KEY

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description: The displayed name of the Journal

fields.name: Issn
fields.description: The Journals ISSN

fields.name: Publisher
fields.description: The Publisher of this Journal

fields.name: ConferenceInstanceId
fields.description: PRIMARY KEY: Unique Identifier for a Conference Instance

fields.name: NormalizedName
fields.description: Normalised name of the Conference

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description: The Displayed name of the Conference

fields.name: Location
fields.description: The location of the Conference

fields.name: OfficialUrl
fields.description: The URL of the Offical Conference Website

fields.name: StartDate
fields.description: The start date of the Conference Instance

fields.name: EndDate
fields.description: The end date of the Conference Instance

fields.name: PaperCount
fields.description: The number of Papers that have been identified from this Conference Instance

fields.name: Latitude
fields.description: The Latitude of the Conference Instance

fields.name: Longitude
fields.description: The Longitude of the Conference Instance

fields.name: ConferenceSeriesId
fields.description: PRIMARY KEY: Unique Identifier for a Conference Series

fields.name: NormalizedName
fields.description: Normalised name of the Conference Series

fields.name: DisplayName
fields.description: The Displayed name of the Conference Series

fields.name: AttributeType
fields.description: 1: PatentId, 2: PubMedId, 3: PmcId, 4: Alternative Title

fields.name: AttributeValue
fields.description: The value of the attribute

fields.name: ResourceType
fields.description: Bit flags. 1 = Project, 2 = Data, 4 = Code

fields.name: ResourceUrl
fields.description: URL of the resource

fields.name: SourceType
fields.description: 1 = Html, 2 = Text, 3 = Pdf, 4 = Doc, 5 = Ppt, 6 = Xls, 8 = Rtf, 12 = Xml, 13 = Rss, 20 = Swf, 27 = Ics, 31 = Pub, 33 = Ods, 34 = Odp, 35 = Odt, 36 = Zip, 40 = Mp3, 0/999/NULL = unknown

fields.name: SourceUrl
fields.description: PRIMARY KEY

fields.name: LanguageCode
fields.description: Language Code

fields.name: grids
fields.description: list of grid id's extracted from the authors fields for easier access

name: open_citations
description: Data sourced from Open Citations https://opencitations.net/

fields.name: citations_total
fields.description: Count of total citations

fields.name: citations_before_publication
fields.description: Count of Citations recorded before the stated publication date

fields.name: citations_one_year
fields.description: Count of Citations recorded in the first year since publication

fields.name: citations_two_years
fields.description: Count of Citations recorded in the first two years since publication

fields.name: citations_five_years
fields.description: Count of Citations recorded in the first five years since publication

fields.name: journal_sc_total
fields.description: For Journal Self Citations: Count of total citations

fields.name: journal_sc_before_publication
fields.description: For Journal Self Citations: Count of Citations recorded before the stated publication date

fields.name: journal_sc_one_year
fields.description: For Journal Self Citations: Count of Citations recorded in the first year since publication

fields.name: journal_sc_two_years
fields.description: For Journal Self Citations: Count of Citations recorded in the first two years since publication

fields.name: journal_sc_five_years
fields.description: For Journal Self Citations: Count of Citations recorded in the first five years since publication

fields.name: author_sc_total
fields.description: For Author Self Citations: Count of total citations

fields.name: author_sc_before_publication
fields.description: For Author Self Citations: Count of Citations recorded before the stated publication date

fields.name: author_sc_one_year
fields.description: For Author Self Citations: Count of Citations recorded in the first year since publication

fields.name: author_sc_two_years
fields.description: For Author Self Citations: Count of Citations recorded in the first two years since publication

fields.name: author_sc_five_years
fields.description: For Author Self Citations: Count of Citations recorded in the first five years since publication

fields.name: source
fields.description: A name for the source (see available sources https://www.eventdata.crossref.org/guide/data/about-the-data/#Sources%20and%20Agents).

fields.name: count
fields.description: Count of the number of Events for the corresponding source.

fields.name: month
fields.description: Year and month the Event is reported to have occurred.

fields.name: source
fields.description: A name for the source (see available sources https://www.eventdata.crossref.org/guide/data/about-the-data/#Sources%20and%20Agents).

fields.name: count
fields.description: Count of the number of Events for the corresponding source.

fields.name: year
fields.description: Year the Event is reported to have occurred.

fields.name: source
fields.description: A name for the source (see available sources https://www.eventdata.crossref.org/guide/data/about-the-data/#Sources%20and%20Agents).

fields.name: count
fields.description: Count of the number of Events for the corresponding source.

name: unpaywall
description: Unpaywall data is sourced from https://unpaywall.org/

fields.name: year
fields.description: The year this resource was published. Just the year part of the published_date

fields.name: publisher
fields.description: The name of this resource's publisher. Keep in mind that publisher name strings change over time, particularly as publishers are acquired or split up.

fields.name: journal_name
fields.description: The name of the journal publishing this resource. The same journal may have multiple name strings (eg, "J. Foo", "Journal of Foo", "JOURNAL OF FOO", etc). These have not been fully normalized within our database, so use with care.

fields.name: url_for_landing_page
fields.description: The URL for a landing page describing this OA copy. When the host_type is "publisher" the landing page usually includes HTML fulltext.

fields.name: url_for_pdf
fields.description: The url_for_pdf if there is one; otherwise landing page URL. When we can't find a url_for_pdf (or there isn't one), this field uses the url_for_landing_page, which is a useful fallback for some use cases.

fields.name: journal_issn_l
fields.description: A single ISSN for the journal publishing this resource. An ISSN-L can be used as a primary key for a journal when more than one ISSN is assigned to it. Resources' journal_issns are mapped to ISSN-Ls using the issn.org table, with some manual corrections.

fields.name: is_oa
fields.description: Is there an OA copy of this resource. Convenience attribute; returns true when best_oa_location is not null.

fields.name: is_in_doaj
fields.description: Is this resource published in a DOAJ-indexed journal. Useful for defining whether a resource is Gold OA (depending on your definition, see also journal_is_oa).

fields.name: journal_is_oa
fields.description: Is this resource published in a completely OA journal.	Useful for defining whether a resource is Gold OA. Includes any fully-OA journal, regardless of inclusion in DOAJ. This includes journals by all-OA publishers and journals that would otherwise be all Hybrid or Bronze OA.

fields.name: unpaywall_oa_status
fields.description: Open access status as determined by COKI where the journal_is_in_doaj field is True or where the best_oa_location location_type field is “publisher” or oa_location field has the location_type “repository”.

fields.name: oa_coki
fields.description: Custom fields created by COKI to determine OA categories

fields.name: open
fields.description: Work is designated as open access by Unpaywall

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Work is not designated as open access by Unpaywall

fields.name: publisher
fields.description: Work is designated as Publisher Open. An article published in an Open Access Journal or made accessible in a Subscription Journal. Where the Unpaywall journal_is_in_doaj field is True or where the Unpaywall best_oa_location location_type field is “publisher”

fields.name: other_platform
fields.description: Work is designated as Other Platform Open. The publication was shared online; on a preprint server, a university library repository, domain repository or an academic staff page. Any article where any oa_location element in the Unpaywall data has the location_type “repository”

fields.name: publisher_only
fields.description: Work is designated as only Publisher Open (and not Other Platform Open or Closed).

fields.name: both
fields.description: Work is designated as both Publisher Open and Other Platform Open.

fields.name: other_platform_only
fields.description: Work is designated only as Other Platform Open (and not Publisher Open or Closed).

fields.name: oa_journal
fields.description: OA Journal. Work is published in an Open Access Journal. We use the journal_is_in_doaj tag from Unpaywall to define this category which requires that there be some licensing information provided.

fields.name: hybrid
fields.description: Hybrid. Work is published in a Subscription Journal with an open license. We check that the license field for the best_oa_location is not null and journal_is_in_doaj is False. This includes the value of “implied_oa” which covers cases where publishers have a general assertion of a license but it is not clear from the page.

fields.name: no_guarantees
fields.description: No Guarantees. Work is published in a Subscription Publisher with no reuse rights. All cases where the best_oa_location is “publisher”, the license field is null, and journal_is_in_doaj is False.

fields.name: preprint
fields.description: Preprint. Work is deposited on servers that do not make claims about formal peer review. Generally non-peer reviewed manuscripts, including working papers on platforms such as arXiv, bioRxiv, SSRN, RePec etc. Where we have manually classified a repository as a preprint server.

fields.name: domain
fields.description: Domain. Work is placed in a domain repository, also known as disciplinary or subject repositories. A domain repository contains publications from a specific subject area. Examples include PubMed Central, Europe PMC and Econstor. Where we have manually classified a repository as a domain repository.

fields.name: institution
fields.description: Institution. Work is placed in an institutional repository, which are archives for storing and distributing an institution's research outputs. Includes repositories shared amongst multiple institutions. Where we have manually matched a repository to an institution, or where oa_locations.repository_institution matches a ROR id with the ROR affiliation matcher, or where the domain from the pmh_id field matches a link from a ROR record.

fields.name: public
fields.description: Public. Work is from a repository that can be used by researchers from any domain and to deposit any form of output, including pre-prints, published manuscripts and datasets. Semantic Scholar, Figshare and Zenodo are a few examples. Where we have manually classified a repository as a public repository.

fields.name: aggregator
fields.description: Aggregator. Work is found on an aggregator. Where we have manually classified a repository as an aggregator.

fields.name: other_internet
fields.description: Other Internet. Work is found on sites we have not classified. In practice these are copies identified by CiteSeer X which is in turn indexed by Unpaywall. It may include publications on academic staff pages, blogs and social networks. We do not directly track outputs on platforms such as academia.edu and researchgate.net. Outputs found on CiteSeer X, which often point to academic staff pages and blogs. We do not currently track outputs from academic social networks. Also includes outputs from repositories that we have not yet classified.

fields.name: unknown
fields.description: Unknown.

fields.name: coki_repository_name
fields.description: Repository name determined manually by COKI

fields.name: endpoint_id
fields.description: oa_location.endpoint_id from Unpaywall

fields.name: repository_institution
fields.description: oa_location.repository_institution from Unpaywall

fields.name: pmh_domain
fields.description: A list of unique OAI PMH hostnames oa_location.pmh_id from Unpaywall

fields.name: pmh_id
fields.description: OAI-PMH endpoint where we found this location. This is primarily for internal debugging. It's null for locations that weren't found using OAI-PMH. oa_location.pmh_id from Unpaywall

fields.name: url
fields.description: The url_for_pdf if there is one; otherwise landing page URL. When we can't find a url_for_pdf (or there isn't one), this field uses the url_for_landing_page, which is a useful fallback for some use cases. best_oa_location.url from Unpaywall

fields.name: institutions
fields.description: Institutional details sourced from https://ror.org/ and mapped to Countries and Regions by COKI

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: Unique ROR ID for the organization

fields.name: types
fields.description: Organization type. Allowed types: Education, Healthcare, Company, Archive, Nonprofit, Government, Facility, Other

fields.name: name
fields.description: The primary name of the organization

fields.name: country
fields.description: Country where organization is located

fields.name: country_code
fields.description: The organization country's ISO 3166 three letter alpha2 code.

fields.name: country_code_2
fields.description: The organization country's ISO 3166 two letter alpha2 code.

fields.name: region
fields.description: The organization country's United Nations Statistics Division M49 region name.

fields.name: subregion
fields.description: The organization country's United Nations Statistics Division M49 subregion name.

fields.name: coordinates
fields.description: The organization's location by latitude and longitude

fields.name: members
fields.description: Membership group manualy derived by COKI

fields.name: funders
fields.description: Funder data is sourced from https://www.crossref.org/services/funder-registry/ and mapped to country and region by COKI

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: Funding body identifier

fields.name: name
fields.description: Funding body primary name

fields.name: doi
fields.description: DOI for the funder

fields.name: types
fields.description: type is always

fields.name: funding_body_type
fields.description: Type of funding body

fields.name: funding_body_subtype
fields.description: Government (gov) or private (pri)
